p: M2, PB1-F2, and NB proteins are classified as viroporins, i.e., virus-encoded short polypeptides (approximately 60–120 amino acids) that have one, two, or even three [ 21] transmembrane (TM) α-helical domains. These polypeptides form oligomers of typically four to six monomers that permeabilize membranes to ions [ 22, 23, 24].
